channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Fall 2025 Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 25, 2025 (all day) - Fall 2025 course evaluations are now open. The evaluation period will be open from November 25th through December 11th. Your feedback is very important to the Institute, the five schools, and their departments, so please complete evaluation surveys for all your courses! Evaluations will be available through Thursday, December 11th, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: CCPD & Naval Nuclear Laboratory Info Session
item.description: The Naval Nuclear Laboratory is the U.S. Navy’s trusted partner for superior propulsion technology, design, testing, training, and support. Join the CCPD and representatives from Naval Nuclear Laboratory VIRTUALLY on Tuesday, December 9th from 6-7pm to learn more about internships, co-ops, and full-time employment!
item.author: Students

item.title: CCPD & GE Vernova Info Session
item.description: Calling all Electrical Engineering students! GE Vernova will be on campus for an info session on Tuesday, December 2nd from 5:30-7:30pm. Come meet with Khine Win (Sr Engineering Manager - Electrical Component) and Zeeky Bukhala (Consulting Engineer - Electrical Accessories) to discuss full time and intern opportunities at GE Vernova within the Gas Power Electrical Engineering team. Register and learn more in Handshake!
item.author: Students

item.title: Graduate Student Lunch and Learn- Personal financial management | Dec. 10 (Registration Required)
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 10, 2025 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM - Professor Brian Clark presents insight into personal financial management. The core areas of managing personal finance consist of income, spending, investments, and protection. Learn how to develop strategies for managing budgeting, emergency funds, debt, and more. HYBRID Event. Seating is limited, and registration is required. Email sanchn2@rpi.edu.
item.author: Students

item.title: Flying Pig Society - Pig Tale: How to Get Your Startup Acquired: When Innovators Celebrate!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 3, 2025 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Want to know how to get your startup acquired? Join us for a Pig Tale on December 3 at 5:00 pm. Our special speaker, Sean Austin who has had a career that includes Spotify, mystery games, and financial analysis, will share his experiences building value in a startup for successful acquisition. Hear Sean tell his story that includes 31 job experiences. The 31st is the charm!
item.author: Students

item.title: Fall 2025 UGED Buzz Newsletter
item.description: The Department of Undergraduate Education is excited to announce the Fall 2025 UGED Buzz Newsletter which highlights happenings from spring/summer 2025. UGED publishes a newsletter each fall and spring term to our campus community so everyone can hear about the exciting initiatives that are going on within the department. Enjoy reading!
item.author: Community

item.title: Procurement Services to Present Supplier Showcase on December 4
item.description: All faculty, staff, and students involved in RPI’s procurement process are invited to attend this year’s Supplier Showcase, which will be held from 11:00am to 2:00pm on Thursday, December 4 in the Alumni Sports & Recreation Center. Stop by to network with RPI’s key suppliers and the Procurement team, get your professional head shot taken, win exciting raffle prizes, have some fun in the photo booth, and enjoy a sparkling spread of savory and sweet treats from campus and local shops!
item.author: Community

item.title: DotCIO - reminder Microsoft has ended support for Windows 10
item.description: Microsoft Windows 10 support ended on October 14th, 2025. At this time Windows 10 systems are no longer eligible for support including important security patches. Without appropriate mitigation, Windows 10 systems are non-compliant with multiple RPI security policies. Please click in for additional information.
item.author: Community

item.title: BME ZOLL Lecture | Dec. 4
item.description: Date: Thursday, December 4, 2025 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM - Professor Jianping Fu of the University of Michigan lectures on Bioengineering Human Embryo and Organ Models
item.author: Community

item.title: iEAR Presents Guest Speaker: Pieter Schoolwerth
item.description: Join us in West Hall 113 on December 3 at 5pm to listen to a talk by Pieter Schoolwerth. After graduating from the California Institute of the Arts in 1994, he moved to New York. From 2003 to 2013, Schoolwerth founded and ran Wierd Records, a now legendary institution based out of New York’s Lower East Side that released music by 46 bands and produced over 500 live shows and performance events.
item.author: Community

item.title: Violin Studio Recital: Bach Celebration!
item.description: Join us on Tuesday December 9 at 7pm in the West Hall Auditorium for a violin studio recital of the students from the studio of Jamecyn Morey. Featuring Bach’s “Concerto for Two Violins in D minor” as well as presenting movements from Bach’s “Sonatas and Partitas for Solo Violin”.
item.author: Community

item.title: MANE Department Seminar - Dr. Alok Ghanekar
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, December 3, 2025 10:30 AM - 11:30 AM - “Breaking Boundaries of Thermal Emission with Active Metasurfaces”, Dr.Alok Ghanekar, Assistant Professor, University of Maryland, Baltimore County

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Community
